text: the holidays are in hot dog Hills like
you've never seen them before bringing
Mickey and his gang's Christmas
adventure to life took dozens of artists
and crew months of preparation and a
little holiday magic it gets even better
team shot on 12 different stages look at
this place which is why they needed to
make six identical puppets for each
character and all of them with handmade
costumes miky and's friends have a dozen
or more different faces with different
mouth shapes Expressions even different
eyebrows they attached to the face with
small magnets and are changed by the
animator in each shot in order to create
words and show
emotions with stop motion every second
of the movie is made of 24 individual
photographs it took 20,000 individual
hande frames and nearly 55,000 shots to
bring it all to life once the rough
animation is done a visual effects team
comes in with their own magic to clean
everything up and paint out things we're
not supposed to
see watch Mickey Saves Christmas on
